title: Karnataka High Court refuses to quash chargesheet against ‚Äòkingpin‚Äô in Valmiki corporation fraud case
content: The High Court of Karnataka on Monday refused to quash a criminal case against G. Satyanarayana Varma, a Hyderabad-based civil contractor, who has been described as ‚Äòkingpin‚Äô in the case involving misappropriation of over ‚Çπ89 crore of the Karnataka Maharshi Valmiki Scheduled Tribes Development Corporation Ltd

title: Higher secondary teachers will boycott clerical duties from September 5: AHSTA
content: AHSTA says making teachers do clerical and office work instead of focussing on teaching is an injustice to students

title: Convicts are entitled for remission even if sentence imposed is for specified term: Karnataka High Court
content: Convicts are entitled to being considered for remission even if the sentence is beyond 20 years or for a specified term, unless the order of sentence makes it clear that the convict shall not be entitled for premature release or remission or parole or the like, said the High Court of Karnataka

title: Inquiry points to intelligence failure in Keezhara blast
content: Despite six cases against Anoop Malik, the main accused, relating to illegal collection and manufacturing of firecrackers, the intelligence wing of the police has failed to identify his involvement in manufacturing and selling gunpowder

title: YSRCP leaders allege several irregularities in Kavali constituency
content: MLAs of coalition parties are involved in corruption and illegal mining, alleges party‚Äôs Nellore district   president Kakani Govardhan Reddy

title: West Bengal doctors‚Äô group demands ‚Äòdismissal of vindictive cases‚Äô against protesting medics
content: In a letter to the Kolkata Police Commissioner, the Joint Platform of Doctors, West Bengal, alleges that the police keep sending summons to doctors ‚Äòciting some trivial insignificant issues related with democratic protests‚Äô. Agitations were held across the State against the rape and murder of a doctor at RGKMCH on August 9 last year

title: This August, Kerala witnessed a sedate monsoon
content: After 2018 and 2019, when the State received extreme rainfall in August, leading to major floods, rain has been more or less on normal lines during the month. This August, the State received 355.8 mm of rain against the average of 445.2 mm, a shortfall of 20%

title: Indian Navy ships conclude Jeddah visit with joint naval exercise
content: During the visit, the ships engaged extensively with the RSNF and Saudi Border Guard through sports fixtures and interactions with personnel.

title: Basava Samskriti Abhiyan to enter Yadgir on Thursday
content: Organised by the Lingayat Mathadhipathigala Okkoota, it will mark the first anniversary of Basavanna being declared cultural icon of the State

title: IRDAI official held in ‚Çπ5.30 crore fund diversion case
content: To clear his debts, the officer devised a scheme to divert IRDAI funds by fabricating invoices, office notes, quotations and other documents, which he pushed through for approval from senior officials.

title: FSU freshman shot, in critical but stable condition
content: Florida State freshman linebacker Ethan Pritchard is hospitalized in critical but stable condition after suffering a gunshot wound Sunday night in Havana, Florida.

title: Miami's Su√°rez appears to spit on Seattle staffer
content: Inter Miami forward Luis Su√°rez appeared to spit on a Seattle Sounders staffer after his team's 3-0 loss in the Leagues Cup final at Lumen Field on Sunday night.

title: 'Whatever it takes': Canes top Irish in showdown
content: Carter Davis made a 47-yard field goal, and No. 10 Miami came up with sacks on back-to-back plays to seal a win over No. 6 Notre Dame on Sunday night.

title: Donald picks familiar names for Ryder Cup team
content: Europe captain Luke Donald filled out his 12-man roster for this month's Ryder Cup with six players who helped the team win back the trophy in Rome two years ago.

title: Sources: Isak to Liverpool in EPL-record transfer
content: Liverpool have agreed to a British-record deal to sign striker Alexander Isak from Newcastle United, sources have told ESPN.

title: Sources: Chiefs, McDuffie don't reach extension
content: The Chiefs and Trent McDuffie, their top cornerback, are not expected to agree to a multiyear contract extension before the start of the season.

title: Ten Hag fired by Leverkusen after just 3 games
content: Former Manchester United manager Erik ten Hag has been sacked by Bayer Leverkusen after just two games in charge, the club has confirmed.

title: üèà Fantasy football PPR rankings for Week 1
content: Weekly individual and composite rankings for each position in PPR and IDP formats, as well as Eric Karabell's superflex ranks.

title: Chaotic recruiting and 'harsh' decisions: Bill Belichick's first nine months at UNC
content: From enlightening and exhilarating to chaotic and tumultuous, there hasn't been anything boring about Belichick at UNC.

title: Six years in the making, Gauff and Osaka set for another US Open showdown
content: Naomi Osaka and Coco Gauff will meet in the fourth round on Monday night. And it's more of a toss-up than recent results suggest.

title: Let's preview the 2025 NFL season: Bold predictions, strengths and concerns for all 32 teams
content: Here's everything you need to know ahead of the NFL regular season, including how teams rank before Week 1.

title: Simulating the entire season: The biggest storylines from one possible outcome
content: We played out on of the Football Power Index's 10,000 season sims, from Week 1 through Super Bowl LX.

title: LIVE: Transfer deadline day news, updates: Liverpool close on Isak, Gu√©hi
content: The summer transfer window closes today and all the big Premier League clubs will be busy in some way. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Welcome to September! Ranking the MLB playoff races that will rule the final month
content: Here's what you need to know about the battles to reach October as teams trying to lock up a postseason spot.

title: Basketball Hall of Fame: Where the 2025 class stacks up for NBA, WNBA
content: Ahead of enshrinement weekend, let's take a closer look at where this year's class ranks in both leagues.

title: Solak: The Packers needed Micah Parsons -- and here's how they should use him
content: Parsons could take Green Bay's defense to another level. Let's look at how he fits into Jeff Hafley's scheme.

title: Only in college football: Week 1's best non-statistical superlatives
content: From USF's trickery and Tommy Castellanos' last laugh to Taylor Swift cheering on Travis Kelce's Bearcats, Week 1 had highlights beyond the box score.

title: Liverpool and Arsenal look incomplete, Fulham VAR drama, Real Madrid win again, more
content: Liverpool and Arsenal wasn't a classic by any means as both teams clearly need to figure things out. "Works in progress" was a recurring theme as Marcotti recaps the weekend

title: WWE Clash in Paris results: Rollins keeps title, holds off Uso, Punk and Knight
content: Seth Rollins retained the World Heavyweight Championship against Jey Uso, CM Punk, and LA Knight, while John Cena beat Logan Paul at WWE Clash in Paris.

title: Canelo vs. Crawford: 10 big fights that define their careers
content: A look at both fighters' best performance, best KO, most dominant fight, the one where they struggled and more.

title: Miranda Wang wins FM Championship by 1 over Jeeno Thitikul
content: Miranda Wang delivered clutch shots over the final three holes for a 2-under 70 and a one-shot victory over Jeeno Thitikul on Sunday in the FM Championship on Sunday.

title: Clay makes his NFL season forecast: Picking the best offenses, top defenses and Super Bowl winner
content: Let's project the NFL's best -- and worst -- offenses and defenses. Plus, how do all 32 teams rank overall, and who will make the Super Bowl?

title: Guide to the rookie class: Who is flying under the radar? Who will win OROY, DROY?
content: Here's everything you need to know about this group of first-years, including Rookie of the Year front-runners.

title: Mike Clay's Playbook, Part 3: How to manage your team post-draft
content: The draft is just the beginning. Mike Clay gives you a guide to being a championship-winning manager.

title: Ramos, Olise join pantheon of singing soccer stars
content: It's been a wild few days in football -- not in terms of rumbling transfer sagas, VAR-related controversies or eyebrow-raising results, but in terms of a surprising amount of new music being released by active players.

title: The VAR Review: Fulham fume at disallowed goal while Man United get late penalty
content: Fulham were furious when Josh King's goal was ruled out at Chelsea, while Manchester United's late victory over Burnley came courtesy of a VAR penalty.

title: MLS Power Rankings: Philadelphia jumps San Diego into top spot
content: Philadelphia Union's statement win over Cincinnati has the Union back on top of ESPN's MLS Power Rankings.

title: Lee Corso's farewell to 'GameDay': Behind the scenes of a football celebrationÔªø
content: Fans, many without tickets to the game, came from all over the country to Columbus to get a glimpse of Corso one last time.

title: 'The Rich Eisen Show' on ESPN: How to listen and watch
content: 'The Rich Eisen Show' is joining forces with ESPN platforms! Find out how to get your weekday dose of pop culture and sports now.

title: Tourists visit hill stations in Chikkamagaluru after booking slots online
content: Chikkamagaluru district administration has restricted the number of vehicles visiting the hill stations in Chikkamagaluru

title: Assault on YouTuber Shajan Scaria: four taken into custody
content: As per FIR, the accused blocked the vehicle in which Shajan was travelling, manhandled him, and attempted to murder him

title: 10 acres allotted to AIISH in Varuna, ready to extend all help: CM
content: AIISH, which works in the area of speech and hearing disorders, is among the best institutions in Asia, says CM

title: BJP is trying to replace a democratic state with a theocratic one, says CPI
content: The national secretariat member of the Communist Party of India hits out at the BJP and RSS over what she claims their divisive, fascist ideologies

title: APPSC to release all exam results by September-end
content: Secretary Raja Babu cautions candidates to avoid errors on OMR sheets that could invalidate their exams

title: Final decision on funding Global Ayyappa Sangamam not yet taken, Kerala govt. tells HC
content: Petitioner challenges move to provide government funding for the meet which he says is more of a political event. He says it is not proper to spend funds on the event that is ‚Äòbeing held in the name of religion‚Äô

title: Tamil Nadu government inks MoUs with three German companies
content: Among the MoUs were one signed with the Munich-headquartered¬†Knorr-Bremse. The company will invest ‚Çπ2,000¬†crore¬†in the establishment of an advanced facility for making railway doors and braking systems in Tamil Nadu

title: PNG Jewellers enters Hubballi market with a new store
content: The 192-year-old Purushottam Narayan Gadgil Saraf and Jewellers is inaugurating its new multi-storey store at Dajibanpet on Thursday

title: Andhra Pradesh government clears IBM proposal to install quantum computer in Amaravati
content: Amaravati Quantum Computing Centre to host IBM‚Äôs 133-qubit quantum computer with free computing hours for academics and government institutions

title: Karnataka received more than normal rain between June 1 and September 1
content: Karnataka between this June 1 and September 1 received 786 mm rainfall as against a normal of 675.6 mm during the south-west monsoon

title: Global Ayyappa Sangamam is aimed at elevating Sabarimala into a global pilgrimage centre, says TDB president
content: He says the Sangamam will provide a platform for discussion on the future development of the hill temple, the Sabarimala airport and railway as well as provide Ayyappa devotees from across the world an opportunity to air their opinions on the government‚Äôs Sabarimala Master Plan

title: CM tears into YSRCP, vows to establish Ramarajya in A.P.
content: By bringing in reforms in irrigation, investments, and welfare schemes, we will rebuild Andhra Pradesh; will not rest till rivers from the Vamsadhara to the Godavari, Krishna, and Penna are linked, Rayalaseema will never again be a parched land, says Chandrababu Naidu

title: Koli, Kabbaliga, Talwar community members stage mega protest in Yadgir
content: They are demanding¬†externment of those who made derogatory remarks against Nija Sharana Ambigara Chowdaiah and Kolis Kabbaligas

title: Naidu distributes NTR Bharosa pensions to beneficiaries in Rajampeta
content: Naidu calls his visit to Rajampeta memorable, marking 30 years since he first became Chief Minister of the combined Andhra Pradesh on September 1, 1995

title: Former V-P Jagdeep Dhankhar vacates official residence
content: Jagdeep Dhankhar has shifted out to¬†Indian Lok Dal¬†President Abhay Chautala‚Äôs farmhouse in Chhatarpur in Delhi, till the Central Public Works Department can ready his retirement home

title: T.N. Chief Minister Stalin visits library at University of Cologne in Germany
content: He points out that his government contributed a sum of ‚Çπ1.25 crore to prevent the closure of the Tamil Department at the university

title: Farmers‚Äô association demands MSP of ‚Çπ2,000 per quintal for onions
content: Farmers allege that despite their struggles, traders have formed cartels and are offering only ‚Çπ500 per quintal for quality onions, pushing cultivators into distress, say association leaders

title: KTU Syndicate to meet on September 2 for Budget clearance; staff await relief before Onam
content: The prolonged delay has caused concern among the nearly 200 employees, who are now pinning their hopes on a Syndicate meeting scheduled for Tuesday.

title: Minister Bharath reviews onion procurement by Markfed in Kurnool
content: Minister for Industries and Commerce says the NDA government has come to the rescue of the farmers and ordered the Markfed to purchase onion at ‚Çπ1,200 per quintal; assures them that the government will support them in all possible ways

title: Bihar SIR: On last day, over 2.17 lakh pleas for removal, 36,000 for inclusion in voters' list
content: The draft electoral rolls were published on August 1 and will remain open for ‚Äúclaims and objections‚Äù from individuals and political parties till September 1

title: YSRCP slams government for neglecting Budameru flood victims
content: YSRCP will launch an agitation if compensation is not paid soon and flood-prevention works such as desilting Budameru are not initiated immediately, says party leader

title: Navigating healthy eating while living alone in a big city
content: We speak to students and working professionals from Bengaluru about how they balance health, time, money and cooking

title: Lockout at Haileyburia Tea Estates withdrawn, work to resume on September 2
content: Meeting held with labour unions at the office of the Chief Inspector of Plantations in Kottayam. It was decided at the meeting to distribute the wages for July on September 3

title: Elathur lake in Erode notified as Tamil Nadu‚Äôs third Biodiversity Heritage Site
content: This follows the previous designations of Arittapatti in Madurai district in November 2022 and Kasampatty in Dindigul district in March 2025

title: Trump targets India again, calls trade 'one-sided disaster'; makes big tariff claim
content: Donald Trump has criticized the trade relationship between the US and India, labeling it a "one-sided disaster." He claims India imposes high tariffs, hindering American businesses, and buys oil and military products from Russia.

title: Leaking flyover & flooded streets: Rain cripples Delhi-NCR; 10 videos reveal havoc
content: Delhi-NCR experienced heavy rainfall and gusty winds on Monday, providing respite from the heat but causing significant disruptions. Waterlogging and traffic jams plagued the region, with rising Yamuna levels prompting flood alerts and the closure of the Old Railway Bridge. Commuters faced severe congestion, and travel advisories were issued by airlines.

title: 'Brahmins profiteering': Trump adviser's remark on Russian oil trade sparks outrage
content: White House trade counselor Peter Navarro ignited controversy by accusing "Brahmins" of profiting from refined Russian oil sales to the West, escalating US-India trade tensions. His remarks, following accusations of India being a "laundromat for Kremlin," sparked outrage and were deemed inflammatory.

title: Trump rattled? US tries to cosy up to India as PM Modi meets Putin, Xi
content: The US Embassy in India affirmed the strong US-India ties, highlighting it as a defining relationship of the 21st century. Despite this positive outlook, trade tensions persist due to recent tariffs imposed by the US, citing trade deficits and India's Russian oil purchases.

title: Salesforce cuts 4,000 jobs: AI replace half of support staff; CEO flip-flops
content: Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff announced a significant reduction of 4,000 customer support positions, a 45% decrease, as AI agents now handle 50% of customer interactions. This shift contrasts with Benioff's July statements, where he downplayed AI's potential for mass unemployment. The company is also utilising AI to address a backlog of over 100 million uncalled sales leads.

title: Army removes TMC stage: Mamata sees red; BJP says CM 'frustrated'
content: The Army dismantled a Trinamool Congress stage in Kolkata's Maidan, citing a violation of permit regulations regarding the duration of events in the area. Mamata Banerjee criticized the BJP, accusing them of using the Army, while urging the forces to remain neutral. TMC alleges political targeting and plans to relocate the protest.

title: Gurgaon flooded: NH-48 traffic crawls for hours; more showers likely in next 2 days
content: Gurgaon was hit by torrential rain on Monday, causing widespread flooding and traffic chaos. Several areas were submerged, with waterlogging reaching up to three feet in depth. Commuters faced severe delays, and the IMD has issued alerts for more heavy showers.

title: AI restructure at Meta: Wang‚Äôs memo to staff makes one thing clear - all report to him
content: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg is intensifying the AI race by reorganizing Meta Superintelligence Labs (MSL) into four specialized teams under Alexandr Wang's leadership. This restructuring aims to accelerate the pursuit of "personal superintelligence," consolidating research, product development, and infrastructure efforts. Key leaders like Nat Friedman and Aparna Ramani will play crucial roles in this ambitious endeavor.

title: What happened when Queen Camilla faced a creep; new book reveals
content: Queen Camilla's past bravery resurfaces in Valentine Low's new book, revealing how she defended herself against a sexual assault on a train as a teenager. She struck her attacker with her shoe, leading to his arrest.

title: 'Not for the ears of others': When Putin offered a lift to 'dear friend' PM Modi
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Russian President Vladimir Putin engaged in an extended private discussion on Monday, taking place within Putin's Aurus limousine following the SCO summit. According to PTI reports, Putin offered Modi a ride, using the opportunity to continue their one-on-one talks for nearly an hour before their scheduled formal bilateral meeting.

title: Ex-VP Dhankhar moves to private farmhouse ‚Äì what about his official house?
content: Former vice-president Jagdeep Dhankhar has vacated his official residence following his resignation and temporarily relocated to a farmhouse in Chhatarpur owned by INLD leader Abhay Chautala. This arrangement will continue until he receives a Type-VIII government residence, which he is eligible for as a former vice-president.

title: Citizenship promise: An entire country is shifting to Australia; First agreement of its kind
content: Nearly 9,000 Tuvalu citizens, representing 82% of the population, have applied for Australia's new climate visa program, a key part of the Falepili Union pact. This initiative aims to provide a pathway for mobility as rising sea levels threaten Tuvalu's habitability. The agreement also commits Australia to defend Tuvalu and gives them a say in its defense pacts.

title: 'Bid to flare tensions': BJP slams Trump aide Navarro's casteist jab
content: Peter Navarro accused India of indirectly funding Russia's war in Ukraine through discounted oil purchases, alleging that Brahmins are profiting at the expense of the Indian people. He criticized India's high tariffs, claiming they hurt American workers and taxpayers while indirectly funding the Russian war machine. Navarro also expressed optimism about trade negotiations with China.

title: 'Blatant interference by Russia': EU chief's plane hit by GPS jamming
content: Ursula von der Leyen's plane faced suspected Russian GPS jamming during landing in Bulgaria. Bulgarian authorities suspect Russian interference. The plane landed safely at Plovdiv International Airport. Von der Leyen was visiting Bulgaria as part of a tour. The region is vulnerable to "Russian hybrid threats."

title: Gold prices hit all-time high of Rs 1.05 lakh per 10g
content: Gold prices soared to a record high of Rs 1,05,670 per 10 grams in the national capital, marking the sixth consecutive session of gains. The surge was fueled by expectations of a US Federal Reserve rate cut and strong overseas demand. Silver prices also reached a new peak of Rs 1,26,000 per kilogram, driven by industrial demand and speculative interest.

title: Watch: What's key to success in politics? Gadkari's unique advise
content: Union minister Nitin Gadkari stated that honesty is challenging in politics, where deception can lead to leadership. Speaking at an event, he emphasized the importance of truth, non-violence, peace, humanity, and equality, drawing inspiration from Chakradhar Swami's teachings. Gadkari also highlighted the significance of values like honesty and dedication in society.

title: Chargers vs Chiefs YouTube coverage: ESPN bans Jason Kelce
content: YouTube's pursuit of Jason Kelce for its exclusive Chargers-Chiefs broadcast in Brazil was thwarted by ESPN. Kelce, now an ESPN analyst, is restricted from appearing on competitor platforms like YouTube due to a new company policy. This decision marks a shift from last season, as ESPN tightens control over its on-air talent amid the rise of streaming in live sports.

title: 'I feel ashamed': Harbhajan on slapping Sreesanth; calls Lalit Modi 'selfish'
content: Lalit Modi stirred controversy by sharing an old video of the infamous IPL 'slapgate' incident between Harbhajan Singh and S. Sreesanth. Harbhajan expressed his disappointment, suggesting a selfish motive behind resurfacing the 18-year-old incident. He acknowledged his mistake, reiterated his regret, and mentioned seeking forgiveness.

title: Over 800 dead, thousands injured in Afghanistan quake; villages flattened
content: A devastating magnitude 6 earthquake struck eastern Afghanistan near the Pakistan border on Sunday, resulting in a tragic loss of over 800 lives and leaving approximately 2,500 individuals injured. The powerful tremors caused widespread destruction, leveling numerous villages and buildings in the affected region. Rescue operations are currently underway, with medical teams dispatched from neighbouring provinces and Kabul to provide assistance.

title: Who is CEO Piotr Szczerek? Man who went viral for snatching a signed cap from kid
content: A viral video from the US Open shows Piotr Szczerek, CEO of Drogbruk, snatching a signed cap intended for a child, sparking global outrage. Social media users identified Szczerek, leading to a barrage of negative reviews for his company. Tennis player Kamil Majchrzak gifted the young fan, Brok, another signed cap.

title: 'Habit of chori': Kharge targets PM Modi - predicts end of NDA rule soon
content: Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge accused Prime Minister Narendra Modi of attempting to steal votes in the upcoming Bihar assembly elections. He asserted that the NDA's double-engine government would soon be ousted, replaced by a government representing the poor, backward communities, and Dalits. Kharge also criticized Bihar CM Nitish Kumar's alliance with the BJP-RSS, questioning his socialist principles.

title: 'Hydrogen bomb soon': Rahul hints new expose on 'vote chori'; BJP reacts
content: Rahul Gandhi, leader of opposition, has accused the BJP of "vote chori" and promised a new expos√©, a "hydrogen bomb," following claims of similar electoral malpractices in Mahadevpura. He asserted that PM Modi would be unable to face the public after this revelation.

title: FIDE CEO slams Hikaru's claims of Carlsen Candidates favouritism
content: FIDE CEO Emil Sutovsky refuted Hikaru Nakamura's claims that the Candidates' rating qualification spot was designed for Magnus Carlsen's potential return. Sutovsky clarified that the rule has existed for years and now benefits top players like Nakamura. He emphasised the spot ensures the inclusion of the world's best, not specifically targeting Carlsen, whose return is deemed unlikely.

title: GST collections hit Rs 1.86L cr; 6.5% increase YoY
content: Goods and Services Tax (GST) collections demonstrated a 6.5% year-over-year increase in August, reaching Rs 1.86 lakh crore, as per official government data. The preceding month saw even higher gross GST collections, totaling Rs 1.96 lakh crore.

title: Polish CEO row: US Open incident sparks outrage; company Drogbruk faces review-bombing
content: A video of Polish businessman Piotr Szczerek grabbing a signed cap intended for a young fan at the US Open sparked widespread outrage. The incident led to a review-bombing campaign against Szczerek's company, Drogbruk, severely damaging its online reputation.

title: Bengaluru man chases live-in partner‚Äôs car, douses her in petrol; sets her ablaze
content: In Bengaluru, a 35-year-old woman, Vanajakshi, tragically died after her live-in partner, Vithal, allegedly set her on fire following a history of domestic disputes. Vithal, a cab driver, was arrested after he intercepted a car Vanajakshi was traveling in, pouring petrol on her and the other occupants at a traffic signal.

title: Night to remember! Rinku finally talks about that unforgettable 5-six finish
content: Rinku Singh's five consecutive sixes in IPL 2023 against Gujarat Titans catapulted him to fame, significantly raising expectations and earning him immense love. He acknowledges the match gave him a unique identity, not just personally but for India. His consistent performance has secured him a place in India's Asia Cup 2025 squad, where they will face UAE, Pakistan and Oman.

title: India reduces US Treasury bill holdings! Gold up in forex reserves; check details
content: India is increasingly favoring gold over US Treasury bills to bolster its foreign exchange reserves, mirroring a global trend of diversifying away from dollar-denominated assets. While India's US T-bill holdings decreased to $227 billion in June 2025, its gold reserves rose significantly to 879.98 metric tonnes.

title: 'Was never desperate to play for India before': Karthik lauds youngster
content: Dinesh Karthik praises Jitesh Sharma's mindset regarding national team selection. Karthik helped Jitesh refine his finishing skills while at Royal Challengers Bengaluru. Jitesh's IPL 2025 performance earned him a spot back on the Indian squad. He aims to solidify his position in the upcoming Asia Cup 2025. Sanju Samson is currently the preferred wicketkeeper.

title: Trump blasts MLB chiefs in push for Roger Clemens Hall of Fame spot
content: Donald Trump wants Roger Clemens in the Baseball Hall of Fame. He urged Clemens to sue Major League Baseball. Trump highlighted Clemens' achievements and denied drug use allegations. He compared Clemens' situation to Pete Rose's case. Trump criticized MLB for delaying Rose's consideration. He emphasized talent should be the reason for Hall of Fame induction.

title: 20% ethanol blended petrol: SC dismisses PIL against nationwide rollout
content: The Supreme Court has dismissed a PIL challenging the nationwide implementation of 20% ethanol-blended petrol (E20). The petition requested that ethanol-free petrol be made available and that ethanol content be clearly labelled at fuel stations. The plea argued that older vehicles and some BS-VI models are not compatible with high ethanol blends, potentially causing damage and higher repair costs.

title: ICC unveils Women‚Äôs WC 2025 prize money; surpasses men‚Äôs edition
content: The ICC has announced a massive 297% increase in prize money for the 2025 Women's Cricket World Cup, totaling $13.88 million. This surpasses the 2023 Men's World Cup payout, signaling a major step towards gender pay parity. Winners will receive $4.48 million, a 239% jump from 2022.

title: Noida: Man shoots self during birthday party after breakup with girlfriend; critical
content: During a birthday celebration in Sector 134's JP Cosmos Society, Vikram Thakur, a 25-year-old unemployed car driver, allegedly shot himself in the head. The incident occurred around 2:15 am, leaving Vikram in critical condition at a private hospital.

title: Boulders fall on tourist vehicle on Kedarnath route after landslide; 2 dead
content: A landslide on the Kedarnath national highway near Munkatiya claimed the lives of two individuals and injured six others on Monday. The deceased, identified as Rita and Chandra Singh from Uttarkashi, were struck by falling debris. The injured, also from Uttarkashi, are receiving medical treatment.

title: Maharashtra: Woman ends life during video call with boyfriend
content: In Thane's Titwala area, a 23-year-old woman tragically died by suicide during a video call with her boyfriend. Police have detained him following accusations from her family of harassment, blackmail, and cheating other women. Allegedly, he took her jewellery and threatened to release private videos when she asked for its return, leading to her desperate act.

title: Asia Cup | Samson vs Jitesh debate ends! Ex-India cricketer gives verdict
content: As the Asia Cup 2025 approaches, debate intensifies over India's wicketkeeper. Aakash Chopra favors Sanju Samson, citing his impressive top-order T20 record with over 6,000 runs at a 140 strike rate. Samson's recent explosive form, including centuries against Bangladesh and South Africa, strengthens his case.

title: SCO member states condemn Pahalgam attack in Tianjin declaration; express condolences
content: The Shanghai Cooperation Organisation (SCO) strongly condemned the terrorist attack in Pahalgam on April 22, 2025, expressing condolences to the victims' families. The SCO reaffirmed its commitment to fighting terrorism, separatism, and extremism, emphasizing that perpetrators must face justice. Following the attack that killed 26, India launched Operation Sindoor, targeting terror hideouts across the border.

title: IPL Slapgate: Match referee breaks silence; calls Harbhajan a good friend
content: Farokh Engineer, the match referee during the infamous 'Slapgate' incident in the 2008 IPL, expressed surprise at the recent release of the footage. He emphasized maintaining confidentiality and believes the matter should remain in the past, as both Harbhajan Singh and S. Sreesanth have likely moved on. The resurfacing of the clip has stirred reactions, with Sreesanth's wife expressing disappointment and anger.

title: Megan McArthur retires from Nasa: First woman to pilot SpaceX Dragon retires
content: NASA astronaut Megan McArthur retires after two decades of remarkable contributions, including piloting the SpaceX Dragon and crucial work on the Hubble Space Telescope. McArthur's career highlights her technical expertise and leadership, notably as the final astronaut to operate Hubble with the space shuttle's robotic arm.

title: Florida‚Äôs 'Alligator Alcatraz' to close: Detention centre empties; judge orders shutdown
content: Florida's controversial immigration detention facility, "Alligator Alcatraz," is set to close following a federal judge's order, highlighting tensions between state and federal authorities. The facility, built rapidly in the Everglades, faced criticism over its remote location, alleged unsanitary conditions, and restricted access for families and lawyers.

title: 'Jee Le Zarra': Farhan Akhtar confirms film still on cards
content: Farhan Akhtar has clarified that 'Jee Le Zaraa,' initially planned with Priyanka Chopra, Alia Bhatt, and Katrina Kaif, is not shelved but is currently on hold. While he's unsure about the original cast's involvement and timing, Akhtar confirms the script and pre-production work are complete. Alia Bhatt also expressed optimism, citing scheduling conflicts as the primary challenge.

title: "It's Getting Late": Trump Claims India "Offered To Cut Tariffs To Nothing"
content: US President Donald Trump claimed Monday that India has offered to reduce its tariffs on US goods to zero, underlining that New Delhi should have done it years ago.

title: How A US Professor Draws Every President And First Lady In 4 Steps
content: John Hutton, a North Carolina art history professor who draws in his spare time, outlined his four-step technique in a new book, "How to Draw the Presidents & First Ladies," published in July by the White House Historical Association.

title: Nagaland Assembly To Start With Discussion On Prohibiting 'Satanic Worship'
content: The three-day monsoon session of the Nagaland assembly will begin on Tuesday with a discussion on the 'prohibition of satanic worship in Nagaland'.

title: Marathas Must Not Be Included In OBC Quota: Maharashtra Minister Chhagan Bhujbal
content: Chhagan Bhujbal said Marathas should not be accommodated in the quota for the Other Backward Classes, citing that only 17 per cent reservation is available for 374 communities in the state.

title: Cleaner Air, Yamuna's Revival: What Delhi's Climate Plan Means for You
content: At a review meeting on Monday, Environment Minister Manjinder Singh Sirsa went over the city's revised State Action Plan on Climate Change, setting targets for 2050 across nine key sectors

title: UP Confectioner Gets Rs 141 Crore Income Tax Notice, FIR Lodged
content: In a bizarre case, a small confectioner in Uttar Pradesh's Bulandshahr district has been served an Income Tax notice of Rs 141 crore, leaving his family shocked and distressed.

title: At 431 Mm, Himachal Pradesh Witnesses Wettest August In 76 Years
content: Himachal Pradesh has witnessed its wettest August in 76 years, recording 431.3 mm of rain in the month, the most since 1949.

title: "Ladke Nahi Hai, Ladte Hai": Mohan Yadav's Jab At Rahul-Tejashwi-Akhilesh
content: Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Mohan Yadav today launched a counter to the Opposition's allegations of "vote theft" in elections and took direct aim at three key faces of the INDIA alliance -- Rahul Gandhi, Tejashwi Yadav and Akhilesh Yadav.

title: Indore's Sarafa Chaat-Chowpatty To Stay At Original Site
content: Indore's legendary Sarafa Bazaar's night food market will stay put in its original place, retaining its distinctive character and heritage.

title: Delhi Directs Closure Of Traffic On Railway Bridge Amid Rising Yamuna Levels
content: The Delhi government has directed authorities to suspend traffic and public movement over the Delhi Railway Bridge from Tuesday, in view of the alarming rise in water levels of Yamuna.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Great American Exodus: Indian Scholars Are Fleeing US - But To Where?
content: As US politics under Trump drives out young researchers, India has an opportunity to lure its brightest scientific minds back. Tamil Nadu is leading the way, but a national strategy is urgently needed.

title: Heavy Rain Leads To Severe Waterlogging In Delhi, Gurugram
content: Huge traffic jams, heavily waterlogged roads, vehicles breaking down, scores of people stuck threw life out of gear as heavy rain hit Gurugram Monday afternoon.

title: IIT-Guwahati Creates Nanosensor For Detecting Cancer-Causing Water Pollutants
content: Researchers at IIT-Guwahati have developed nanosenor from milk protein and thymine for instant detection of cancer-causing water pollutants, the institute said on Monday.

title: Jagdeep Dhankhar Moves To Farmhouse As He Waits For Keys To Government Bungalow
content: Jagdeep Dhankhar has vacated his official residence and moved to a private farmhouse in the Chhatarpur area of South Delhi, more than a month after he resigned as vice president. It belongs to INLD leader Abhay Chautala.

title: Man Finds Dead Rat In His Paneer Dish At UP Dhaba
content: Two people who had gone to a dhaba (roadside eatery) for a meal here found a dead rat in their dish, an official said on Monday.

title: West Bengal's Priests, Drummers Fear Travelling To Other States For Festivities
content: Reports of Bengali-speaking migrants being allegedly harassed in Maharashtra, Gujarat, Delhi, and Rajasthan have cast a long shadow over the season of celebration.

title: BJP Escalates Dharmasthala Central Probe Demand With March To Temple Town
content: Karnataka's opposition BJP is pushing ahead with its demand for a Central investigation into the huge controversy over allegations of murder and burial of young girls in pilgrim town Dharamsthala.

title: Over 800 Killed, 2,800 Injured In Afghanistan Earthquake: What We Know So Far
content: More than 800 people were killed and thousands more injured as a major earthquake struck southeastern Afghanistan late on Sunday, one of the worst such disasters in the country in recent years.

title: French Streamer Says 'Didn't Kill' Co-host In Live Broadcast
content: A French streamer whose colleague died during a live broadcast denied responsibility on Monday, in a case that has pitted the government against the Kick platform and spotlighted extreme online stunts.

title: A's monitor Kurtz; Chourio returns for Brewers with homer
content: the fantasy baseball buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around MLB . the nationals are slated to call up Andrew Alvarez to start against the marlins . alvarez posted a 3.95 ERA and 1.35 WHIP as a 2nd .

title: Army player rescues man from burning vehicle
content: a second-year cadet at the service academy was traveling with his family when they saw a vehicle surrounded by downed power lines . the vehicle collided with a utility pole , causing the power lines to fall to the ground .

title: Projecting the CFP top 12 after Week 1
content: "the days of a national champion being undefeated are over," coach Steve Sarkisian says . the longhorns aren't alone, but the early results shook up the playoff pecking order . here's what the selection committee's top 12 would look like if it were released today .
